content:
It is probably https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1891962.

According to the users with whom I have corresponded, the crash frequency can be reduced by removing or increasing the time interval of automatic checks for new mail in the pop account settings - 15-30 minutes for example.
creator: wsmwk

content: OK. I have now changed every account to 30 minutes. I will wait with bated breath to see what happens next.
creator: jhnhth75

content: Does problem improve if you start Windows in safe mode with networking enabled - https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/help/12376/windows-10-start-your-pc-in-safe-mode ?
creator: wsmwk

content: Muhtemelen sunucunuzdan kaynaklanan bir sorun var. E-posta hizmeti aldığınız firmaya danışmalısınız.
creator: maxcoder

content:
In account settings, select the account and at the bottom of the list choose the delete action.

FWIW see https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/sending-and-receiving-messages-thunderbird#w_problems
creator: wsmwk

content: Could be. Also, what AV do you use?
creator: wsmwk

content:
Wayne Mery 说
Could be. Also, what AV do you use?

I've been using Huorong AV, VPN, and Thunderbird with network auto-detect, without any issues until last week. Recently, I’ve been facing frequent problems where Thunderbird can’t connect to my SiteGround mail server. It freezes when sending emails and when saving emails to the sent folder. I have around 2GB of emails, so I’m wondering if that’s related.

I spent a lot of time today: I uninstalled Thunderbird, deleted all related files, and then downloaded the latest ESR version (128.58.0esr x64) from the official website. After re-setup, I still faced freezing when recognizing email settings at first, but it eventually worked. I’m still using Huorong AV + VPN + Thunderbird (network auto-detect). Everything seems normal now, but I don’t understand what the issue was.

Anyone know why this happens? Also, any suggestions for antivirus software that can scan Thunderbird emails for viruses?
creator: mrchan

content: Probabilmente ha raggiunto dimensioni eccessive per poter essere compattata. Prova a dividere i messaggi che contiene in più sottocartelle e poi riprova a compattarle.
creator: @next

content: Il problema non mi sembra che sia in stretta correlazione alle dimensioni delle cartelle. Questo, sia perché le cartelle non sono oggettivamente di dimensioni "importanti" (avendo io cura di "sfoltirle" periodicamente, sia perché lo stesso problema si presenta anche con account "gmail" diversi dal mio principale (fortunato.amodeo@gmail.com) ed in cui non vi è quasi nulla. Grazie per l'attenzione
creator: fortunato.amodeo

content: Als Thunderbird er geen ‘vlampictogram’ aan koppelt vindt de kwalificatie als Ongewenst niet door Thunderbird plaats, maar waarschijnlijk op de e-mailserver. U kunt dan inderdaad het beste naar uw webmail gaan en daar aangeven dat deze berichten geen spam zijn.
creator: markh2

content: Mogelijk staan de serverinstellingen niet helemaal goed; welke provider gebruikt u en hebt u wellicht onlangs Thunderbird bijgewerkt? Sinds wanneer hebt u dit probleem?
creator: markh2

content: We hebben al aantal weken een probleem met de mails. We hebben Thunderbird niet bijgewerkt, we gebruiken het al jaren en nooit hebben we problemen gehad. Wij hebben internet via Scarlet maar zij verwijzen ons door naar Thunderbird. Hoe kunnen we die serverinstellingen aanpassen?
creator: caryl.strzelecki

content:
Zie https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/configuratieopties-accounts om uw serverinstellingen te controleren en eventueel aan te passen.

zie https://www.scarlet.be/scarlet-support/nl/id_sfaqr_mailbox/particulieren/support/internet/e-mail-website/e-mail-instellen/scarlet-mailbox-gids-instellingen-en-tips.html voor de juiste instellingen van scrarlet
